funestim 1.0.0
  • Get started
  • Reference

Perform an estimation of the mean with local linear smoothers.

Source: R/estimate_mean.R
mean_ll.Rd

This function performs the estimation of the mean of a set of curves using local linear smoothers where the bandwidth is estimated using the methodology from Golovkine et al. (2021).

mean_ll(
  data,
  U = seq(0, 1, length.out = 101),
  t0_list = 0.5,
  grid = NULL,
  nb_obs_minimal = 2,
  kernel = "epanechnikov"
)

Arguments

data

A list, where each element represents a curve. Each curve have to be defined as a list with two entries:

  • $t The sampling points

  • $x The observed points.
U

Vector, sampling points at which estimate the curves.
t0_list

Vector, the sampling points at which we estimate the parameters.
grid

Vector, default=NULL. A grid of bandwidths.
nb_obs_minimal

Integer, minimum number of observation for the smoothing.
kernel

Character string, the kernel used for the estimation:

  • epanechnikov (default)

  • uniform

  • biweight

Value

A list of with two entries:

  • $parameter The estimated parameters.

  • $mu The estimated mean.

References

Golovkine S., Klutchnikoff N., Patilea V. (2021) - Adaptive estimation of irregular mean and covariance functions.

Contents

Developed by Steven Golovkine.
